forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: A new high-profile terror attack in India tied to Pakistan-based groups or time-sensitive intelligence on high-value targets/launch sites in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa prompts Indian air/drone/missile/artillery strikes into Pakistan proper (e.g., KP or Pakistani Punjab). forecast.rationale: I put extra weight on the status quo: historically, Indian kinetic strikes into Pakistan proper are rare (Balakot 2019 is the main clear precedent), and crises often plateau after an initial retaliatory action. The research assistant reports that after the April 22 Pahalgam attack, India escalated sharply—suspending the Indus Water Treaty, closing Attari-Wagah, banning SAARC visas, and launching ‘Operation Sindoor’ with targeted strikes including some in Pakistan proper. That recent precedent does raise the risk of follow-on action, but it can also satisfy domestic demands for retribution, reducing the need for additional June strikes. Strong international pressure (U.S., Gulf states, China) and Pakistan’s fragile economic/political context favor de-escalation over a sustained campaign inside Pakistan’s provinces. Moreover, many Indian cross-border actions occur in PoK, which would not count for this question. Why not higher: base rate for June strikes into Pakistan proper remains low; nuclear-escalation risks and diplomatic costs are significant; Eid al-Adha in mid-June may further disincentivize a fresh strike window absent a trigger. Why not lower: the environment is already escalatory; India has demonstrated willingness to hit in Pakistan proper in 2025 per the RA; an ongoing named operation creates some probability of additional waves; leadership incentives to maintain deterrence are present. Updaters: I would raise the probability materially if (1) there is a significant new attack in India credibly linked to Pakistan-based militants; (2) credible reporting of Indian force mobilization, NOTAMs/airspace restrictions near the western sector, or public threats by senior Indian officials; (3) indications Operation Sindoor is explicitly continuing into June. I would lower it if (1) there are signs of backchannel talks/mediation producing CBMs, (2) partial reversal/softening on diplomatic/economic steps (e.g., reopening the border), or (3) Pakistan undertakes visible steps against implicated groups reducing Indian casus belli.
